code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor("green")

p3 = turtle.Turtle()
p3.color('black')
p3.shape('turtle')
p3.penup()
p3.goto(-120,20)
p3.pendown()

guide.img: Now that we have created our second player, Let’s go ahead and create our next player with the same logic
Let’s create another player, and set its colour to black and shape to the turtle
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor("green")

p3 = turtle.Turtle()
p3.color('black')
p3.shape('turtle')

guide.img: Since the difference between each player is 30 pixels along the y axis, the x-axis will remain at -120, the y will be at 20
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()

p3 = turtle.Turtle()

p3.goto(-120,20)
